p: A guaiane-type sesquiterpene, 1,7-epidioxy-5-guaiene ( 15) was found and later isolated from Axinyssa sponge [ 75], and an oxygenated sesquiterpenoid, 1,7-epidioxy-5-guaien-4-ol called peroxygibberol ( 16), was isolated from a Formosan soft coral, Sinularia gibberosa, which demonstrated moderate cytotoxicity toward a human liver carcinoma cell line [ 76]. Structures ( 16â€“35) can be seen in Figure 2, and their biological activity is presented in Table 2.
